title: Arrow shatters glass door at Oak Lawn mayor's business - Daily Southtown
text:
An arrow was shot through a double-pane glass door at the main entrance of Complete Vision Care, the business owned by Oak Lawn Mayor Sandra Bury, late Sunday or early Monday, police reported.
The arrow shattered the glass and lodged in a chair about 10 feet from the entrance, Bury said, adding that no one was inside when it happened.
Bury said she and the police department are taking the incident "very seriously. "I'm very happy no one was hurt. If there were children or teenagers playing with this (arrow), I'm happy it hit my building. I'd rather it hit the door than go out into traffic on 95th Street where it really could have hurt someone."
There are security cameras focused on the entrance to the optometry shop, and police are reviewing those, police Division Chief Randy Palmer said.
"It's a practice arrow so we can't really track it. Sometimes, arrows are cut to certain lengths to fit bows. But a practice arrow isn't. It could have come from any (store)," Palmer said. "... I know it got through a double-pane glass door and into a chair, so it had some pretty good velocity."
A delivery driver for the Chicago Tribune called police at 4:48 a.m., telling them he had found a glass door shattered at Complete Vision Care, 6209 W. 95th St., according to police. They said Bury was called, arrived on the scene and unlocked the doors to the business.

(Steve Metsch) She told police that nothing was missing or appeared to have been damaged. The glass door has been boarded up.
"My utmost concern is the safety of my patients and my staff," Bury said. "If someone is making a (political) statement about me, this affects all those people and it's not something frivolous or something that can be taken lightly. It's a disgusting, cowardly act. I'm just hoping that it's kids who were being mischievous."
